p: Table 2 shows that EEG acts as a competitive inhibitor against α-glucosidase. In fact, by increasing the concentration of extract, a family of straight lines with different slope, all intersecting on the y-axis, was found ( Figure 1(a)). This kinetic analysis indicates that the extract binds with the free enzyme and the equilibrium constant, K I = 0.08 µg/mL, was obtained from the slope ( K m / V max) versus inhibitor concentration.
